Posts.Content: Cathy_pa wrote: I recently joined the forum for myself as you can see below, but one of my best friends has recently done her first mammo at age 45 (despite that her mom had breast CA at age 43) and was called back for a diagnostic and US and is now going in for biopsy on weds. She is trying hard not to freak out. So US report shows "8mm ovoid nodular mass with angulated borders".. Any thoughts on this? Good?Bad? Ugly? I told her at least they have a specific place to biopsy... When they found my DCIS they were just shooting into an area of calcifications. Anyone here ever hear of this kind of finding and know anything? She's nervous obviously.... She and her mom have been my rock solid supporters during my cancer issues.... I'm now 5 weeks out from my mastectomies and back to work... Feeling pretty well. But I think it lit the fire under her butt to get checked out. My heart hurts for her if it turns out to be cancer... We live states apart. Let me know your thoughts if you have any. Dx 10/2/2015, DCIS, Right, 1cm, Stage 0, Grade 3, 0/5 nodes, ER+/PR+ Surgery 11/1/2015 Lumpectomy: Right; Lymph node removal: Sentinel Surgery 2/22/2016 Prophylactic mastectomy; Reconstruction (left): Tissue expander placement; Reconstruction (right): Tissue expander placement Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Friend with ovoid nodule... Getting ready for Bx Cathy_pa Cathy_pa

Posts.Content: Apr 2, 2016 09:32AM Cathy_pa wrote: again?? Wondering has anyone heard of this?? She sent me her Mammo US reports and no BI-RAD
Posts.Title: Friend with ovoid nodule... Getting ready for Bx Cathy_pa Cathy_pa

Posts.Content: Apr 11, 2016 02:06PM Cathy_pa wrote: she found out today- BENIGN! A fibroadenoma- they'll check again w US in 6 mos!!! Yay
